org.atteo.moonshine.jetty

Class Jetty

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.atteo.evo.config.Configurable
      • org.atteo.moonshine.ConfigurableService
        • org.atteo.moonshine.TopLevelService
          • org.atteo.moonshine.webserver.WebServerService
            • org.atteo.moonshine.jetty.Jetty
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Service

    public class Jetty
extends WebServerService
    Starts Jetty web server instance.

    • Configuration

      • XML

        <!--
            Starts Jetty web server instance.
        -->
        <jetty>
            <sslcontextfactories>
                <? extends SslContextFactoryConfig>...</? extends SslContextFactoryConfig>
            </sslcontextfactories>
            <!-- List of connectors. -->
            <connectors>
                <? extends ConnectorConfig>new ConnectorConfig[] { new ServerConnectorConfig() }</? extends ConnectorConfig>
            </connectors>
            <!--
                Main handler. Usually a {@link HandlerCollectionConfig collection} or {@link HandlerListConfig list}
                of handlers. By default set to {@link ServletContextHandlerConfig}.
            -->
            <? extends HandlerConfig>new ServletContextHandlerConfig()</? extends HandlerConfig>
        </jetty>

    • Method Detail

      • getSubServices

        public Iterable<? extends Service> getSubServices()
        Description copied from interface: Service
        Returns a list of direct sub-services this service contains.

        Although usually the list will come from unmarshalling the XML file, there is nothing which forbids the service from generating the list on the fly.

        Only direct sub-services should be returned. Moonshine will on its own ask returned sub-services for their sub-services.

        Specified by:
        getSubServices in interface Service
        Overrides:
        getSubServices in class ConfigurableService
        Returns:
        list of services

      • start

        public void start()
        Description copied from interface: Service
        Starts this service.

        All fields marked with Inject will be injected before execution of this method.

        This method should be used to start functionalities which are used outside this application. Functionality that is exported to other services should be started in Service.configure() method or from Provider to correctly handle dependencies between services.

        Specified by:
        start in interface Service
        Overrides:
        start in class ConfigurableService

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Description copied from interface: Service
        Stops this service.

        Service can still be started later using Service.start() method.

        Specified by:
        stop in interface Service
        Overrides:
        stop in class ConfigurableService
